description: Manage private link scope of an Azure Arc-Enabled Server.

commands.name: az connectedmachine private-link-scope create
commands.summary: Create an Azure Arc PrivateLinkScope. Note: You cannot specify a different value for InstrumentationKey nor AppId in the Put operation.
commands.syntax:
az connectedmachine private-link-scope create --name
                                              --resource-group
                                              [--location]
                                              [--public-network-access {Disabled, Enabled, SecuredByPerimeter}]
                                              [--tags]
examples: az connectedmachine private-link-scope create --location westus --resource-group my-resource-group --scope-name my-privatelinkscope

commands.name: az connectedmachine private-link-scope delete
commands.syntax:
az connectedmachine private-link-scope delete [--ids]
                                              [--name]
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--resource-group]
                                              [--subscription]
                                              [--yes]
examples: az connectedmachine private-link-scope delete --resource-group my-resource-group --scope-name my-privatelinkscope

commands.name: az connectedmachine private-link-scope list
commands.summary: Get a list of Azure Arc PrivateLinkScopes for a resource group or a subscription.
examples:
az connectedmachine private-link-scope list --resource-group my-resource-group
az connectedmachine private-link-scope list

commands.name: az connectedmachine private-link-scope show
examples: az connectedmachine private-link-scope show --resource-group my-resource-group --scope-name my-privatelinkscope

commands.name: az connectedmachine private-link-scope update
commands.summary: Update an Azure Arc PrivateLinkScope. Note: You cannot specify a different value for InstrumentationKey nor AppId in the Put operation.
commands.syntax:
az connectedmachine private-link-scope update [--add]
                                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--ids]
                                              [--name]
                                              [--public-network-access {Disabled, Enabled, SecuredByPerimeter}]
                                              [--remove]
                                              [--resource-group]
                                              [--set]
                                              [--subscription]
                                              [--tags]
examples: az connectedmachine private-link-scope update --tags Tag1=Value1 --resource-group my-resource-group --scope-name my-privatelinkscope

commands.name: az connectedmachine private-link-scope wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
